Not sure what to think of it honestly..
Its like CSGO or team fortress vibes, more csgo than anything but more barebones with hint of very early call of duty.
The servers, Nobody that talkative, Not noobie friendly seems Hard to get use to the stiffness of it all ,If you come from newer titles  like Batllefield 1 or call of duty ww2 etc you' ll find yourself stuggling with dated  combat system. its much more slower, stripped down and just camp, shoot, medic, shoot, run, die , but im a noob so..
Voice chat is a plus, But i feel like even though its there people keep it to strictly team chat , like where enemys are at, or you'll see that someone servers are no swearing, no jokes, no breathing , kind , not my thing. too PG.
Probally Good back in day.but i find myself thinking SO MANY better titles, Pick up COD WAW over this, just my opinion

After playing the original Day Of Defeat and then this, I can say this is very dumbed down. The movement is simplified and allows dancing and jumping around while in the original game you simply get shot if you try and have to just hug the ground instead. The maps aren't nearly as good, with no flanking or anything in mind. There are some enterable buildings, which just serve as simple cover points along the same path. The weapons dont play as well, and are just bland with no feeling to them and seem to do a bit less damage too except for bolt-actions, which doesn't go well with the larger hitboxes, and it just generally plays like Counter Strike or Call Of Duty or some other generic shooter. No excitement, no thinking or tactics, just walk forward, then jump around and spray until their HP runs out. The only advantage this has over the original is the great physics of the Source engine, but really you don't get to see the physics in action much in such a game anyway. Far inferior to the original Day Of Defeat. The first time I haven't been happy with a Valve game.

This is essentially like counter strike, but simpler. No money, less game modes and more to the point. The same graphics and similar action, yet instead of being in modern time it is set in WW2 era just between the US and Nazis. No British, no Russians and the weapons all seem to match the team you play on. This is a good online shooter and best played with a lot of people in between each other.

10/10

a fun, pure online-only shooter game worth a bargain

"Day of Defeat: Source" (DODS) is a nice little game, although it is currently lacking in player numbers.

It is a World War Two version of "Counter-Strike: Source".

I played DODS a long time ago, and it was quite fun.
I tried it playing it again, but found almost no-one on the servers (two servers had one person in them).

However, there were about a dozen servers running, so presumably some people are still playing the game (I noted that there were some Australian and American servers).
It might be better to give DODS a try on the weekend, as more people would be likely to be on then.

If a server with bots was available, that would be good.

I'm going to give "Day of Defeat: Source" a thumbs-up because I know it's a fun game.
Although people should be aware that the game is very nearly dead.
